questions.question: Which UNESCO World Heritage Site in South America, known for its stunning terraced landscapes and historical significance, was once the heart of the Incan Empire and was rediscovered in 1911?
questions.context: This iconic archaeological site is set high in the Andes Mountains and is renowned for its complex architecture and panoramic views.

questions.question: Which monument in an Asian capital symbolizes peace and is located in the center of the city where it marks the end of colonial rule?

questions.question: What site in the United States marks one of the earliest human space travel achievements and is a symbol of lunar exploration history?
